Package org.neo4j.kernel.impl.store.format

Interface RecordFormat<RECORD extends AbstractBaseRecord>

  • Type Parameters:
    RECORD - type of AbstractBaseRecord this format handles.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseOneByteHeaderRecordFormat, BaseRecordFormat, DynamicRecordFormat, LabelTokenRecordFormat, MetaDataRecordFormat, NodeRecordFormat, NoRecordFormat, PropertyKeyTokenRecordFormat, PropertyRecordFormat, RelationshipGroupRecordFormat, RelationshipRecordFormat, RelationshipTypeTokenRecordFormat, SchemaRecordFormat, TokenRecordFormat
    public interface RecordFormat<RECORD extends AbstractBaseRecord>
    Specifies a particular record format, used to read and write records in a RecordStore from and to a PageCursor.

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description

    • Field Detail

      • NO_RECORD_SIZE

        static final int NO_RECORD_SIZE
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • newRecord

        RECORD newRecord()
        Instantiates a new record to use in read(AbstractBaseRecord, PageCursor, RecordLoad, int, int) and write(AbstractBaseRecord, PageCursor, int, int). Records may be reused, which is why the instantiation is separated from reading and writing.
        Returns:
        a new record instance, usable in read(AbstractBaseRecord, PageCursor, RecordLoad, int, int) and write(AbstractBaseRecord, PageCursor, int, int).

      • getRecordSize

        int getRecordSize​(StoreHeader storeHeader)
        Returns the record size for this format. Supplied here is the store header of the owning store, which may contain data affecting the record size.
        Parameters:
        storeHeader - StoreHeader with header information from the store.
        Returns:
        record size of records of this format and store.

      • getRecordHeaderSize

        int getRecordHeaderSize()
        Returns:
        header size of records of this format. This is only applicable to DynamicRecord format and may not need to be in this interface.

      • isInUse

        boolean isInUse​(PageCursor cursor)
        Quickly determines whether or not record starting right at where the cursor is placed is in use or not.
        Parameters:
        cursor - PageCursor to read data from, placed at the start of record to determine in use status of.
        Returns:
        whether or not the record at where the cursor is placed is in use.

      • read

        void read​(RECORD record,
          PageCursor cursor,
          RecordLoad mode,
          int recordSize,
          int recordsPerPage)
   throws IOException
        Reads data from cursor of the format specified by this implementation into record. The cursor is placed at the beginning of the record id, which also record refers to.
        Parameters:
        record - to put read data into, replacing any existing data in that record object.
        cursor - PageCursor to read data from.
        mode - RecordLoad mode of reading. See RecordStore.getRecord(long, AbstractBaseRecord, RecordLoad, PageCursorTracer) for more information.
        recordSize - size of records of this format. This is passed in like this since not all formats know the record size in advance, but may be read from store header when opening the store.
        Throws:
        IOException - on error reading.

      • prepare

        void prepare​(RECORD record,
             int recordSize,
             IdSequence idSequence,
             PageCursorTracer cursorTracer)
        Called when all changes about a record has been gathered and before it's time to convert into a command. The original reason for introducing this is the thing with record units, where we need to know whether or not a record will span two units before even writing to the log as a command. The format is the pluggable entity which knows about the format and therefore the potential length of it and can update the given record with additional information which needs to be written to the command, carried back inside the record itself.
        Parameters:
        record - record to prepare, potentially updating it with more information before converting into a command.
        recordSize - size of each record.
        idSequence - source of new ids if such are required be generated.
        cursorTracer - underlying page cursor tracer

      • write

        void write​(RECORD record,
           PageCursor cursor,
           int recordSize,
           int recordsPerPage)
    throws IOException
        Writes record contents to the cursor in the format specified by this implementation.
        Parameters:
        record - containing data to write.
        cursor - PageCursor to write the record data into.
        recordSize - size of records of this format. This is passed in like this since not all formats know the record size in advance, but may be read from store header when opening the store.
        recordsPerPage - number of records per page. All stores know in advance how many records of particular format can fit on a page.
        Throws:
        IOException - on error writing.

      • getNextRecordReference

        long getNextRecordReference​(RECORD record)
        Parameters:
        record - to obtain "next" reference from.
        Returns:
        "next" reference of records of this type.
        See Also:
        RecordStore.getNextRecordReference(AbstractBaseRecord)

      • equals

        boolean equals​(Object otherFormat)
        Can be used to compare against another RecordFormat, returns true the format represented by obj is the exact same as this format.
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object
        Parameters:
        otherFormat - other format to compare with.
        Returns:
        whether or not the other format is the same as this one.

      • hashCode

        int hashCode()
        To match equals(Object).
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class Object

      • getMaxId

        long getMaxId()
        Maximum number that can be used to as id in specified format
        Returns:
        maximum possible id

      • getPageSize

        int getPageSize​(int pageCachePageSize,
                int recordSize)
        Page size of store file represented by current record format
        Parameters:
        pageCachePageSize - page cache page size
        recordSize - store format record size
        Returns:
        page size for file
